page.title: 13SWAFFHAM PRIOR HOUSE GARDENS
page.content: Swaffham Prior House has now got approx. 50 acres of land. Some of it is woodland and some is grassland. Until the early 19th. Century the garden was a rectangle of 10 acres. A small park of 45 acres was laid out in the early 1800s and an enlargement of the park was made in the 1880s. The total land cover was 140 acres. Also in 1880 an elaborate water garden was created and a line of trees planted. In the garden there is still a waterfall in existance and two Chinese Bridges, which the water ran under. The water has dried up now. Five wells have also been discovered on the land. There is an interesting ice box on the land. This consists of a 40 feet deep hole. It was a form of refridgeration and helped preserve the food for the family.
